description: Solution to a(n)^(n^2/a(n)) = GCD[n^n, product(k^k) for k<n] where a(n) and n^2/a(n) are integers, or 0 if no such integers.
formula: a(2) = 1, a(4) = 0, a(8) = 16, a(9) = 27; if p an odd prime: a(p) = 1 and a(2p) = 4p; otherwise if n>1: a(n) = n. Apart from n = 4, a(n) = n^2/A056584(n) = A056582(n)^(1/A056584(n)).
example: For n = 4, there are no integer solutions of a^(16/a) = 4, though there are two real solutions of about 1.099997 and 43.55926.a(9) = 27 because GCD[,] = 19683 = 27^3 and 27*3 = 9^2
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 03 2000
